label: Microsoft SharePoint
description: Arcade.dev LLM tools for Microsoft SharePoint

tools.name: CopyItem
tools.description: Copy a file or folder. Returns a completed item or an operation id.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the drive where the item lives.

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: The ID of the item to copy.

parameters.name: destination_folder_id
parameters.description: Optional destination folder ID. If omitted, the item is copied to the same folder.

parameters.name: new_name
parameters.description: Optional new name for the copied item.

tools.name: CreateFolder
tools.description: Create a new folder in a SharePoint drive.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the drive where the folder will be created.

parameters.name: folder_name
parameters.description: The name of the new folder.

parameters.name: parent_folder_id
parameters.description: Optional parent folder ID. If omitted, creates in the drive root.

tools.name: CreatePresentation
tools.description:
Create a new PowerPoint presentation in a SharePoint drive.

The presentation will be created with a title slide containing the specified title.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the SharePoint drive to create the presentation in.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title for the new presentation.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: The ID of the folder to create the presentation in. If not provided, the presentation will be created in the root of the drive.

tools.name: CreateShareLink
tools.description: Create a share link for a SharePoint drive item.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the drive where the item lives.

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file or folder to share.

tools.name: CreateSlide
tools.description:
Append a new slide to the end of an existing PowerPoint presentation in a SharePoint drive.

The slide will be added at the end of the presentation. Both title and body
are optional to support layouts like BLANK or TITLE_ONLY.

For presentations larger than 4 MB, the upload uses a resumable session.
Concurrency protection (etag check) is best-effort in that case, since
Microsoft Graph upload sessions do not support If-Match headers.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the SharePoint drive containing the presentation.

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: The ID of the PowerPoint presentation to add a slide to.

parameters.name: slide_title
parameters.description: The title for the new slide. Optional for layouts like BLANK.

parameters.name: slide_body
parameters.description: The body content for the new slide. Supports markdown: **bold**, *italic*, __underline__, and bullet points (- item, indented with spaces for nesting). Optional for layouts like TITLE_ONLY or BLANK.

parameters.name: layout
parameters.description: The layout to use for the slide. For TWO_CONTENT layout, use create_two_content_slide.

output.description: The updated presentation details with new slide info.

tools.name: CreateTwoContentSlide
tools.description:
Append a TWO_CONTENT slide with side-by-side content areas to the end of a SharePoint PowerPoint.

This layout is useful for comparisons, pros/cons lists, or any content that
benefits from a two-column layout.

For presentations larger than 4 MB, the upload uses a resumable session.
Concurrency protection (etag check) is best-effort in that case, since
Microsoft Graph upload sessions do not support If-Match headers.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the SharePoint drive containing the presentation.

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: The ID of the PowerPoint presentation to add a slide to.

parameters.name: slide_title
parameters.description: The title for the new slide.

parameters.name: left_body
parameters.description: Content for the left side of the slide. Supports markdown: **bold**, *italic*, __underline__, and bullet points (- item, indented with spaces for nesting).

parameters.name: right_body
parameters.description: Content for the right side of the slide. Supports markdown: **bold**, *italic*, __underline__, and bullet points (- item, indented with spaces for nesting).

output.description: The updated presentation details with new slide info.

tools.name: CreateWordDocument
tools.description: Create a new Word document in a SharePoint drive (4MB upload limit). Optionally include text content.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the SharePoint drive to create the document in.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: File name without extension, or with .docx. The .docx extension is normalized.

parameters.name: text_content
parameters.description: Optional text content to include in the new document. If omitted, an empty document is created.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: Optional parent folder DriveItem ID. If omitted, the document is created in the root.

parameters.name: conflict_behavior
parameters.description: Optional conflict behavior when a file with the same name exists. One of: fail, rename, replace.

tools.name: DeleteItem
tools.description: Delete a file or folder from a SharePoint drive.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the drive where the item lives.

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file or folder to delete.

tools.name: GetAllSlideNotes
tools.description:
Get all speaker notes from every slide in a SharePoint PowerPoint presentation.

Returns notes for all slides in one call, which is more efficient than
calling get_slide_notes for each slide individually. Notes are returned
in markdown format.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the SharePoint drive containing the presentation.

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: The ID of the PowerPoint presentation.

output.description: All speaker notes from the presentation.

tools.name: GetCopyStatus
tools.description: Check status of an async copy operation using the full monitor URL.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the drive where the copy operation runs.

parameters.name: operation_url
parameters.description: The full monitor URL returned by copy_item (Location/Operation-Location header). DO NOT PROVIDE ONLY THE OPERATION ID, BUT THE FULL URL.

tools.name: GetDrivesFromSite
tools.description:
Retrieve drives / document libraries from a SharePoint site.

If you have a site name, it is not necessary to call Sharepoint.SearchSites first. You can simply
call this tool with the site name / keywords.

parameters.name: site
parameters.description: Site ID, SharePoint URL, or site name to get drives from. Prefer using a site ID whenever available for optimal performance.

output.description: The drives from the SharePoint site.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetItemsFromList
tools.description:
Retrieve items from a list in a SharePoint site.

Note: The Microsoft Graph API does not offer endpoints to retrieve list item attachments.
Because of that, the only information we can get is whether the item has attachments or not.

parameters.name: site
parameters.description: Site ID, SharePoint URL, or site name to get lists from. Prefer using a site ID whenever available for optimal performance.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The ID of the list to get items from.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetListsFromSite
tools.description: Retrieve lists from a SharePoint site.

parameters.name: site
parameters.description: Site ID, SharePoint URL, or site name to get lists from. Prefer using a site ID whenever available for optimal performance.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetPage
tools.description:
Retrieve metadata and the contents of a page in a SharePoint site.

Page content is a list of Microsoft Sharepoint web part objects, such as text, images, banners,
buttons, etc.

If `include_page_content` is set to False, the tool will return only the page metadata.

parameters.name: site
parameters.description: Site ID, SharePoint URL, or site name to retrieve base pages from. Prefer using a site ID whenever available for optimal performance

parameters.name: page_id
parameters.description: The ID of the page to retrieve.

parameters.name: include_page_content
parameters.description: Whether to include the page content in the response. Defaults to True. If set to False, the tool will return only the page metadata.

output.description: The page from the SharePoint site.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetPresentationAsMarkdown
tools.description:
Get the content of a PowerPoint presentation stored in a SharePoint drive as markdown.

This tool downloads the presentation and converts it to a markdown representation,
preserving text content, tables, and chart data. Images and other media are
represented as placeholders.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the SharePoint drive containing the presentation.

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: The ID of the PowerPoint presentation to read.

tools.name: GetSite
tools.description: Retrieve information about a specific SharePoint site by its ID, URL, or name.

parameters.name: site
parameters.description: Site ID, SharePoint URL, or site name to search for.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetSlideNotes
tools.description:
Get the speaker notes from a specific slide in a SharePoint PowerPoint presentation.

Speaker notes are returned in markdown format, preserving basic formatting
like bold, italic, and bullet points.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the SharePoint drive containing the presentation.

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: The ID of the PowerPoint presentation.

parameters.name: slide_index
parameters.description: The 1-based index of the slide to get notes from.

output.description: The speaker notes for the specified slide.

tools.name: GetWordDocument
tools.description: Get a Word document's metadata and content from a SharePoint drive (supports only `.docx`). Returns the document content as Markdown by default, or just metadata when metadata_only is True.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the SharePoint drive containing the document.

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: The DriveItem ID of the Word document.

parameters.name: metadata_only
parameters.description: If True, return only the document metadata without downloading the content. Defaults to False.

output.description: The Word document metadata and optionally its content.

tools.name: InsertTextAtEndOfWordDocument
tools.description:
Append text to the end of an existing Word document.

This tool only supports files with the `.docx` extension and enforces the 4MB limit.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the SharePoint drive containing the document.

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: The DriveItem ID of the Word document.

parameters.name: text_content
parameters.description: The text content to append to the document.

tools.name: ListItemsInFolder
tools.description:
Retrieve items from a folder in a drive in a SharePoint site.

Note: Due to how the Microsoft Graph API is designed, we have to retrieve all items, including the ones
skipped by offset. For this reason, the tool execution time tends to increase with the offset value.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the drive to get items from.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: The ID of the folder to get items from.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of items to get. Defaults to 100, max is 500.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip.

output.description: The items from the folder in the drive.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListPages
tools.description:
Retrieve pages from a SharePoint site.

The Microsoft Graph API does not support pagination on this endpoint.

parameters.name: site
parameters.description: Site ID, SharePoint URL, or site name to retrieve base pages from. Prefer using a site ID whenever available for optimal performance.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of pages to return. Defaults to 10, max is 200.

output.description: The pages from the SharePoint site.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListRootItemsInDrive
tools.description:
Retrieve items from the root of a drive in a SharePoint site.

Note: Due to how the Microsoft Graph API is designed, we have to retrieve all items, including the ones
skipped by offset. For this reason, the tool execution time tends to increase with the offset value.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the drive to get items from.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of items to get. Defaults to 100, max is 500.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip.

output.description: The items from the root of a drive in a SharePoint site.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListSites
tools.description: List all SharePoint sites accessible to the current user.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of sites to return. Defaults to 10, max is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset to start from.

output.description: The SharePoint sites matching the search criteria.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: MoveItem
tools.description: Move a file or folder to a new location in a SharePoint drive.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the drive where the item lives.

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: The ID of the item to move.

parameters.name: new_parent_id
parameters.description: The ID of the destination folder.

tools.name: SearchDriveItems
tools.description:
Search for items in one or more Sharepoint drives.

Note: when searching within a single Drive and/or Folder, due to how the Microsoft Graph API is designed,
we have to retrieve all items, including the ones skipped by offset. For this reason, the tool execution
time tends to increase with the offset value.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The keywords to search for files in the drive.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: Optionally, the ID of the drive to search items in. If not provided, the search will be performed in all drives.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: Optionally narrow the search within a specific folder by its ID. If not provided, the search will be performed in the whole drive. If a folder_id is provided, it is required to provide a drive_id as well.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of files to get. Defaults to 50, max is 500.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of files to skip.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SearchSites
tools.description:
Search for SharePoint sites by name or description.

In case you need to retrieve a specific site by its name, ID or SharePoint URL, use the
`Sharepoint.GetSite` tool instead, passing the ID, name or SharePoint URL to it. If you use
the `Sharepoint.SearchSites` tool to retrieve a single site by its name, too much CO2 will be
released in the atmosphere and you will contribute to catastrophic climate change.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The search term to find sites by name or description.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of sites to return. Defaults to 10, max is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset to start from.

output.description: The SharePoint sites matching the search criteria.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SetSlideNotes
tools.description:
Set or update the speaker notes on a specific slide in a SharePoint PowerPoint.

Notes can be formatted using markdown:
- **bold** for bold text
- *italic* for italic text
- __underline__ for underlined text
- Lines starting with - or * become bullet points
- Indent with spaces for nested bullets

For presentations larger than 4 MB, the upload uses a resumable session.
Concurrency protection (etag check) is best-effort in that case, since
Microsoft Graph upload sessions do not support If-Match headers.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the SharePoint drive containing the presentation.

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: The ID of the PowerPoint presentation.

parameters.name: slide_index
parameters.description: The 1-based index of the slide to set notes on.

parameters.name: notes
parameters.description: The speaker notes in markdown format. Supports **bold**, *italic*, __underline__, and bullet points (- or *).

tools.name: WhoAmI
tools.description: Get information about the current user and their SharePoint environment.

output.description: Get comprehensive user profile and SharePoint environment information.
